node.title: 'I can't forgive': Survivors of Stolen Generations receive apology decades after abuse and torment in NT
node.alt: First Nations survivors of abuse from the Garden Point mission have recieved an apology in Darwin on November 18, 2021.Â
node.description: Almost 60 years after the Garden Point Mission closed, the Aboriginal children who were stolen from their families and abused at the institution have received a public apology.
node.content:
["Almost 60 years after the Garden Point Mission closed, the Aboriginal children who were stolen from their families and abused at the institution have received a public apology.", "Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that the following story contains the name of a person who has died.", "Maxine Kundie was taken from her mother to the mission on Melville Island in the Northern Territory, along with her brother Alfie and sister Josie.", "At an event in Darwin this week, she shared their stories of torment and abuse at the institution, which was run by the Missionaries of the Sacred Heart and the Daughters of Our Lady of the Sacred Heart.", "\"The sexual abuse that went on there \u2026 Alfie's was the most horrific story I ever heard,\" she said.", "\"I watched my brother in the last three months [of his life] \u2014 he went downhill.\"", "Ms Kundie was the lead plaintiff in a class action seeking compensation and justice for the surviving children of Garden Point.", "They reached an undisclosed settlement with the Darwin Diocese of the Catholic Church and federal government earlier this year, with both parties denying liability.", "Her brother Alfie was one of many who died before hearing an apology or receiving financial compensation for harm done at Garden Point.", "\"Maybe one day you can look to the skies and say, 'Thank you, Alfie',\" she said.", "", "
Maxine Kundie paid tribute to her brother Alfie, who did not live long enough to hear the apology.\u00a0(ABC News:\u00a0Myles Houlbrook-Walk)
", "East Arrente woman Zita Williams was stolen from her mother in 1947 and taken more than 1,000 kilometres from her home to Garden Point.", "\"Pretty hard to comprehend that somebody can do such a cruel thing to take away \u2026 because of my colour of my skin and that's all it was,\" she said.", "\"That our people were not able to look after us because they were black.\"", "The 82-year-old's voice trembled when she spoke of the pain that continued\u00a0to haunt her.", "
Apology not accepted by some survivors
", "Ms Kundie said the damage that had been done by federal authorities was too great.", "\"I can't forgive the Commonwealth for what they did to the Stolen Generation, because you took these kids, you destroyed their lives,\" she said.", "\"To the Commonwealth, you destroyed Stolen Generation lives and there's never ever going to be closure.\"", "", "
Zita Williams (right)\u00a0wants\u00a0the apology to empower her fellow survivors.\u00a0(ABC News:\u00a0Myles Houlbrook-Walk)
", "Ms Williams said her fellow survivors could be empowered by the apology.", "\"I'm so proud of all of you. You can do things, you can move on. A lot of you think that the apology, you can't do nothing. You can move on,\" she said.", "The Bishop of Darwin, Charles Gauci, acknowledged the pain and suffering inflicted by the church and government.", "\"I believe and strongly feel that these children should never have been stolen from their parents,\" he said.", "\"These children should have been safe once they were there, in the care of church people [but] sadly some of them at least were abused.", "", "
This plaque on Melville Island is the only formal reminder of Garden Point's history as a mission for children part of the Stolen Generations.(ABC News: Stephanie Zillman)
", "Sister Mary Stevens issued an apology on behalf of the Daughters of Our Lady of the Sacred Heart, and\u00a0Father John Kelliher apologised\u00a0on behalf of the Missionaries of the Sacred Heart.", "However, no federal ministers attended the public apology.", "Instead, the government was represented by the acting chief executive of the National Indigenous Australians Agency, Blair Excell.", "\"While survivors of Garden Point Mission are stolen generations members, the apology today was delivered in the context of them being victims of institutional child abuse,\" a spokeswoman for the Minister for Indigenous Australians said.", "\"The National Indigenous Australians Agency managed the Garden Point Mission litigation on behalf of the Commonwealth and it was agreed during settlement proceedings that a senior representative from each of the respondent parties would deliver the formal apology.\"", "Separate to the Garden Point class action settlement, a federal redress scheme was announced this year for Indigenous Australians forcibly removed from their families in the Northern Territory, the ACT and the Jervis Bay Territory."]
